questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters has a list of Platinum members containing 50,000 subscribers and a Lifetime Member list containing 20,000 subscribers; 7,000 subscribers in the Lifetime Member list also exist in the Platinum Member list.
An email was deployed to the Platinum members, but the marketing team would now like to send the same email to the Lifetime Member list.
Which feature should be used when sending the second email to ensure that the 7,000 subscribers that exist on both lists don't receive the same email twice?

discussion.content:
A. Responsive Aware: This method uses desktop and mobile email versions.
The email client identifies the device and shows the right version.
It takes time to develop and code two email versions.
B. Mobile Aware: This method entails creating one email that works on desktop and mobile devices.
Usually employs a single-column layout with larger text and buttons for mobile readability and clickability.
Only one email version is created and coded, making implementation easier and faster than Responsive Aware.
D. Mobile Responsive: Media queries adjust email layout, pictures, and fonts based on screen size.
Media queries and device testing make it harder to install than Mobile Aware.
Allows for screen size customization but takes longer to design and code.
The ideal solution for a quick turnaround and straightforward installation is:
B. Mobile-friendly
It balances mobile optimization and ease of execution, making it ideal for a marketing intern on a tight deadline producing an email campaign.

Within Datorama Reports for Marketing Cloud, a marketer would like to create a new set of reports for the organization that are custom and not available within the preconfigured reports.

What should be created to achieve this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To create custom reports in Datorama Reports for Marketing Cloud, you should create a Collection.

A Collection allows you to gather and organize data from various sources, apply custom calculations, and create reports tailored to your organization's specific needs. It serves as a container for your custom reports and data transformations.

A Dimension typically represents a specific attribute or characteristic of data, while a Dashboard is a way to visualize and display multiple reports and data visualizations in one place, but it doesn't involve creating custom reports themselves.

So, the correct answer is:

A. A Collection
